{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pulpectomy is a treatment performed on a primary tooth with extensive decay and involving pulp in the root canal. It is indicated when inflammation of the pulpal tissue extends into the root canals, and possibly involves the periapical and/or bifurcation areas. However, pulpectomy is not recommended for primary teeth without a successor. This is because the primary purpose of a pulpectomy is to preserve the tooth until the permanent successor is ready to erupt. If there is no successor, there is no need to preserve the primary tooth.", "answer_choice": "B"}
